title: Self-important lawyers on Twitter are damaging the reputation of our justice system
text:
The Bar Standards Board this week published guidelines on lawyers’ use of social media sites, including in it reminders that they were bound by Core Duty 5 of the board’s handbook not to “behave in a way which is likely to diminish the trust and confidence which the public places in… the profession,” and warning them against using “comments designed to demean or insult”.

The timing of this announcement could not have been more apt. Lawyers, necessarily, have been thrust into the spotlight as a result of the constitutional mess created by the process of the UK leaving the EU (some rather more prominently, and by design, than others).

But with the elevation of the legal profession at such a tense...
